intro: Hieracium alticaule, commonly known as the tallstalk hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, rough to the touch, and often have a hairy texture. Hieracium alticaule produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
